briefdescription.para: Pointer to the start of the next token.

detaileddescription.para: This pointer always lies between program_ptr and program_ptr + strlen(program_ptr).

briefdescription.para: Pointer to the character after the next token.

detaileddescription.para: This pointer always lies between program_ptr and program_ptr + strlen(program_ptr).

briefdescription.para: Current token type.

detaileddescription.para: A numeric representation of the token between ptr and nextptr. The value should always be within the token_t enum.

briefdescription.para: Current line number in the program.
True if the program has thrown an error and should terminate.

detaileddescription.para: This flag might not cause immediate termination if the program is inside an EVAL.

briefdescription.para: True if the program has ended.

detaileddescription.para: This occurs when the program reaches an explicit END statement or falls off the end of the program, triggering termination.

briefdescription.para: True if the program has "claimed flipping".

detaileddescription.para: This is relevant to the internal state of the program's execution.

briefdescription.para: Pointer to the program's entire text (untokenized).

detaileddescription.para: This may have been processed by a preprocessing phase to remove unnecessary spacing, etc.

briefdescription.para: Debugging status flag (e.g., DEBUG_* values).

detaileddescription.para: Holds information about the current debugging state.

briefdescription.para: Array of active debug breakpoints (line numbers).

detaileddescription.para: Used during program execution for debugging purposes.

briefdescription.para: Number of active breakpoints.
Local buffer for parsing function/procedure parameter lists.
Local integer variable stack for function/procedure scopes.

detaileddescription.para: Each index in this array corresponds to a specific depth in the call stack.

briefdescription.para: Local string variable stack for function/procedure scopes.
Local double (real) variable stack for function/procedure scopes.
Call stack for return line numbers during function, procedure, or GOSUB calls.

detaileddescription.para: Each index corresponds to a call in the stack, with a maximum depth of MAX_CALL_STACK_DEPTH.

briefdescription.para: Pointer indicating the current position in the call stack.

detaileddescription.para: Starts at 0 and can go up to MAX_CALL_STACK_DEPTH - 1.

briefdescription.para: Repeat stack for handling REPEAT...UNTIL loop control.

detaileddescription.para: Holds the return line numbers for each level of loop nesting.

briefdescription.para: Pointer indicating the current position in the repeat stack.
Previous length of the program text, used to detect an EVAL in progress.

detaileddescription.para: If this value is non-zero, an EVAL is in progress, and the program has appended additional lines. If zero, no EVAL is executing.

briefdescription.para: The return line number for an EVAL statement.
FOR loop stack to handle FOR...NEXT loops.

detaileddescription.para: Contains return line numbers for each level of loop.

briefdescription.para: Pointer indicating the current position in the FOR loop stack.
Definitions of procedures and functions in the program.

detaileddescription.para: Linked list of all function and procedure definitions.

briefdescription.para: Global integer variable list.

detaileddescription.para: Stores all globally scoped integer variables in the program.

briefdescription.para: Global string variable list.
Global double variable list.
Global integer array variable list.
Global string array variable list.
Global double array variable list.
Console object used for I/O operations in the program.
Expected return type of the function being executed.

detaileddescription.para: This is used when executing a function atomically to determine the type of the return value.

briefdescription.para: Pointer to the return value of the function being executed.

detaileddescription.para: This is used for storing the result of a function's execution.

briefdescription.para: Bracket depth when parsing function or procedure parameter lists.

detaileddescription.para: Keeps track of nested parentheses during parameter parsing.

briefdescription.para: Item start pointer when parsing function or procedure parameters.
Linked list of parameters for functions and procedures.

detaileddescription.para: This is used when parsing parameter lists in function/procedure calls.

briefdescription.para: Current graphics color for graphical operations (e.g., drawing lines, shapes).
The last CPUID instruction result, used for system information.
Hashmap for quick lookup of line numbers in the program.

detaileddescription.para: Provides efficient access to the program's lines for execution.

briefdescription.para: Current depth of block IF...THEN...ELSE statements.

detaileddescription.para: This is used for managing nested IF statements and ensuring correct execution flow.

briefdescription.para: Highest line number in the program.

detaileddescription.para: Keeps track of the largest line number in the program for reference.

briefdescription.para: Array of sprites used in the program (if any).
Storage area for garbage-collected strings.

detaileddescription.para: This holds strings that are subject to garbage collection.

briefdescription.para: Pointer to the next free position in the garbage-collected string storage.
Buddy allocator used for managing the program's heap.

detaileddescription.para: The allocator is used to manage dynamic memory for the program's variables and data structures.

briefdescription.para: BASIC program context.

detaileddescription.para: Every instance of a BASIC program has one of these contexts. Certain structures, such as functions, will clone the context and run on the clone until the function completes. Cloned contexts share variables, and you should never call basic_destroy() on them as they are handled differently.
